tit.e: Mt. Wakakusa (a mountain in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 若草山（わかくさやま）は奈良県奈良市、奈良公園の東端に位置する標高342m、面積33haの山。
sen.e: Mt. Wakakusa (wakakusa-yama) is a mountain located in the eastern edge of Nara Park in Nara City, Nara Prefecture, and it is 342 meters high and with an area of 33 hectares.

sen.j: 山が三つ折り重なっているため三笠山（みかさやま、みかさのやま）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Because three mountains looked overlapped, it is called Mikasa (three shades) yama (mountains) or Mikasa (three shades) no yama (mountains).
Because three mountains looked overlapped, it is called Mikasa-yama or Mikasa no yama (mountains with three shades).
Because three mountains looked overlapped, it is called Mikasa-yama or Mikasa no yama (mountains with three shades).

sen.j: かつては三笠山が正式名称であった。
sen.e: In the past, Mikasa-yama was its formal name.

sen.j: 1935年、この山名に因んで三笠宮が創設される際に、同じ名前では恐れ多いとして山焼きに因んで若草山に改称した。
sen.e: When the Mikasanomiya imperial household was established and took its name from Mikasa-yama in 1935, to humble itself and show respect for the Mikasayama imperial household, Mikasa-yama was renamed Wakakusa-yama after mountain burning.

sen.j: 北海道三笠市は、この山に因んで名づけられた同名の山が由来である。
sen.e: Mikasa City, Hokkaido was named after another mountain which had been named after this Mt. Wakakusa (Wakakusa-yama).
Mikasa City, Hokkaido was named after another mountain of the same name which had been named after this Mt. Wakakusa.

sen.j: なお、阿倍仲麻呂の和歌「あまのはらふりさけみれば春日なる三笠の山に出でし月かも」の「三笠の山」はこの山のことではない。
sen.e: For your information, `Mt. Mikasa' referred in ABE no Nakamaro's waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables), `あまのはらふりさけみれば春日なる三笠の山に出でし月かも' is a different mountain from this Mt. Wakakusa (Wakakusa-yama).

sen.j: 南隣にある春日山原始林のことであり、春日山は御蓋山と書いて「みかさやま」の別名がある。

sen.j: なお日露戦争での日本海海戦の旗艦、戦艦「三笠 (戦艦)」はこの山の名にちなんで命名されている。
sen.e: By the way, the flagship used in Nihonkai Kaisen (Naval battle of Japan sea) at the time of Russo-Japanese War, the battleship `Mikasa' (battleship), is named after this mountain.

sen.j: 毎年1月に行われる山焼きは、1760年に東大寺と興福寺による領地争いが発端といわれているが定かではない。
sen.e: It is uncertain, but is said that the mountain burning held in every January began when a dispute over territories between Todai-ji Temple and Zokofuku-ji Temple occurred in 1760.

sen.j: 山頂には仁徳天皇の皇后磐之姫命の墓といわれる、鶯塚古墳がある。
sen.e: On the mountain top, there is Uguisuzuka Tumulus, which is said to be the tomb of Iwanohime no mikoto, the empress of Emperor Nintoku.
On the mountain top, there is Uguisuzuka-kofun Tumulus, which is said to be the tomb of Iwanohime no mikoto, the empress of Emperor Nintoku.
